text: Pour the beans out of the cans into a colander for draining. Run cold water over them briefly to remove the brine. (It's the brine that contributes to wind or bloating and reduces the tastiness of the beans.) Pour the beans onto the chopping board. Chop roughly. Turn the bread into breadcrumbs. Stick it through a blender or food processor. It's a good idea to break into smaller chunks for blending or processing. Pour all of the ingredients bar the cooking oil and coating flour into the mixing bowl. Mix together well. Shape into around 6 to 8 burgers.  Coat with flour, just lightly.  Heat the oil in the frying pan on gentle heat. Place the burgers into the pan and fry gently. They'll need approximately 5 minutes each side to cook properly. Remove from heat. They can be drained on kitchen towel if they seem a bit greasy. Otherwise, they're good to go between sliced bread or rolls, with the addition of lettuce, tomato and sauce if wished. Finished.
